Posts.Content: Kpr2018 I’m probably having the same treatment. Starting chemo today. Sitting in the chair waiting. Delayed as they are waiting on results of my MUGA scan 4cm mass with nodal involvement. I’ve not had MRI or Ct scans.xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hope you all managed to have a relaxing Christmas. I had pertuzumab, Docetaxel,carboplatin and herceptin on 18th. The first couple of days I felt ok. Day 3 I had blurred vision a heart rate of 49 and BP 117/57. I am on medication for high blood pressure and sinus tachycardia. The chemo triage suggested I ring my GP. I have now come off 2 of my bp meds but still taking bisoprilol. Thankfully my BP and heart rate have stabilised. Wondering if  the herceptin lowered my BP. Christmas Day my mouth became sore and I started with the runs.i phoned the chemo triage team again on Boxing Day who suggested I ring 111. After a visit to Out of hours GP I have Nystan as I have oral thrush. No appetite for anything. Food I do manage has no taste. I haven’t been able to enjoy a cup of tea for days. My tummy is still not right. I am taking a few of the anti runs tablets a day. Please tell me the next cycle will be better( 9th Jan)  On the plus side we have signed up to rent a beachside apartment for 6 months. All I need to bring with me is a suitcase of clothes. It’s on the ground floor as opposed to where I am now with 2 flights of stairs. Xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks AnnJac, im struggling with what to drink so it’s tending to just be water. Is the first one usually the worst? At least I’ll have an idea of what to expect next time and have everything ready. Xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks all for the support. up early to go for my heart scan. Fingers crossed it’s all ok. Should I pop into the breast centre to ask who my BCN is? Xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi, I am starting chemo on Tuesday. TCPH. It’s all been a bit of a rollercoaster ride. I. Haven’t yet been assigned a breast Cancer Nurse. Having a pre assessment on Monday. What sort of questions should I ask? So scared xxx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear that Helen K. Hope you feel better soon before the next lot xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi hammie, i am a couple of weeks ahead of you but with a similar treatment plan. I had my first session of chemo yesterday that so far hasn’t been to bad. Good luck. Other than a MUGA scan on Monday I have had no other scans. Hoping that these will be set up as keep thinking ‘what if? ‘
Posts.Title: Waiting, waiting, waiting

Posts.Content: This is not somewhere I ever thought I would be. Having had to take I’ll health retirement at 52 5 years ago because of autoimmune disorders I was in a good place since January this year having got my life back on track. i was called for a routine mammo screening in October and had recently felt a lump. I wasn’t too concerned as about 5 years ago a lump on my left Breast was shown to be fibroadenoma and I was told I had a couple of areas on my right too. I mentioned the lump to the radiographer. I wasn’t surprised then to have a recall last Friday but was shocked when told I had breast cancer but just needed a biopsy to confirm.i think I am still in denial and just wish 3rd December would come round quickly so that I know what I’m dealing with.  The mass is about 3cm and an enlarged lymph node was visualised! What does this really mean? Could there be a mistake? These are all thoughts going round in my head. i have a month long holiday booked from 16th December. Am I going to have to cancel it?But if it’s really bad news it could be the last one I have for a long time. so many thoughts. hope I haven’t bored you too much. Xx
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Thank you HappyFeet1 i just wish I had the rest of my results so that I can move forward. thinking of ringing the nurse tomorrow to try and chase them up. Is she likely to tell me what stage too?  I had a lovely afternoon/ evening with my children and husband xx
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Update i didn’t need to ring the nurse, she rang me the results are Herceptin positive, Er - awaiting a phone with an appointment to see the oncologist. i feel better for knowing. X
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies and friendliness i think if possible I will go on holiday. We have my stepdaughter and her family joining us for one of the weeks and I would hate to disappoint them. hoping that a mistake has been made and that it’s just an area of inflammation caused by my autoimmune disorders( has that ever happened to anybody?) hope the 3rd hurries up so that I know what I’m dealing with and can take back control. i suppose I’m a bit of a control freak xx
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Update i didn’t need to ring the nurse, she rang me the results are Herceptin positive, Er - awaiting a phone with an appointment to see the oncologist. i feel better for knowing. X
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Thankyou Lottie8 i think I have to come off my Humira and Cellcept but it’s good to know the chemo may help the autoimmune disorders. just wish I could see the Oncologist before Tuesday xx

Posts.Content: Thank you HappyFeet1 i just wish I had the rest of my results so that I can move forward. thinking of ringing the nurse tomorrow to try and chase them up. Is she likely to tell me what stage too?  I had a lovely afternoon/ evening with my children and husband xx
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Update on my previous post. i had some results yesterday.3.9 cm cancer with lymph node involvement. The surgeon initially spoke about a lumpectomy and axillary node clearance. Unable to say with certainty as they are still awaiting some biopsy results! i am surprisingly calm. My main concern is what if there are secondaries. I asked about a CT scan and that is not on the cards. its my birthday today, what a lovely present! i am still planning on going on holiday although the surgeon mentioned an op beginning of January( we get back 13th) Knowing the state of NHS if I had something booked init would be cancelled due to emergencies after Christmas and New Year. I feel it’s more important to make memories(my stepdaughter and family are joining us for our last week) I will use the time away to do lots of walking and build up my strength for the long journey ahead of me.. xx
Posts.Title: Hi from a Newbie

Posts.Content: Yes it is Mycophenalate. I’m also on Salazopyrin. I’m seeing the rheumatologist on Tuesday too so I will chat to them about it all. Xxx
